For every natural number `n`, `Nat.div2 n` equals the floor of `n/2`.

statement: theorem Nat.div2_val : ∀ (n : ℕ), n.div2 = n / 2 := by sorry
name: Nat.div2_val
description: This theorem states that for every natural number `n`, the value of the function `Nat.div2 n` is equal to the floor of `n/2`. In other words, `Nat.div2 n` gives the greatest integer that is less than or equal to `n/2`. This theorem provides a formal proof in Lean 4 that this function indeed behaves as expected based on its definition.
concise-description: For every natural number `n`, `Nat.div2 n` equals the floor of `n/2`.
